throw.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to make an object such as a ball move quickly through the air by pushing your hand forward quickly and letting the object go
throw.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: He threw his shirt to someone in the crowd.
Someone threw a stone at the car.
a crowd of boys throwing snowballs at each other
Throw me that towel, would you.
throw.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to put something somewhere quickly and carelessly
throw.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: He threw a handful of money onto the table.
Don’t just throw your clothes on the floor – pick them up!
throw.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to push someone or something roughly and violently
throw.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The bus stopped suddenly and we were all thrown forwards.
The guards threw Biko to the ground and started kicking him.
The bomb exploded, throwing bricks and debris into the air.
She drew the curtains and threw open the windows.
throw.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to make your opponent fall to the ground in a sport in which you fight
throw.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: if a horse throws its rider, it makes them fall onto the ground
throw.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: to suddenly and quickly move your hands, arms, head etc into a new position
throw.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: I threw my arms around her and kissed her.
He threw his head back and laughed.
throw.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: to make someone feel very confused
throw.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: It threw me completely when she said she was coming to stay with us.
throw.translation[0].note_box[0].section: to make something such as a ball or stone move quickly through the air using your hand
I threw the ball back to him.
Protestors began throwing stones at the police.
I just threw the letter in the bin.
toss
to throw something, especially in a careless way without using much effort
She tossed her coat onto the bed.
Can you chuck me the remote control?
hurl
to throw something with a lot of force
Someone hurled a brick through his window.
fling
to angrily throw something somewhere with a lot of force, or to carelessly throw something somewhere because you have very little time
He flung her keys into the river.
I flung a few things into a suitcase.
heave
to throw something heavy using a lot of effort
They heaved the log into the river.
lob
to throw something high into the air over someone or something
The police lobbed tear gas canisters over the heads of the demonstrators.
to throw a ball in a sport
to throw the ball to another member of your team
He passed the ball to Wilkinson, who kicked the ball over the goalposts.
pitch
to throw the ball to the batter in a game of baseball
Stoddard pitched for the Chicago White Sox.
bowl
to throw the ball towards the person who is batting in a game of cricket
Harmison bowled superbly and took 5 wickets.
throw.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: an action in which someone throws something
throw.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: an action in which someone rolls a dice in a game
throw.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: a large piece of cloth that you put loosely over a chair to cover it and make it look attractive
throw.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to try to solve a problem by spending a lot of money, without really thinking about the problem
throw.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: There is no point throwing money at the pollution problem.
throw.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: to waste money by spending it on something that has already failed
throw.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: As the project devoured more than £4 million, we began to wonder if we were throwing money down the drain.
